DOC.brief_summary: The main goal project investigate psychological process underlie moral judgment social dilemma . WE examine neuroendocrine determinant moral judgment investigate effect exogenous testosterone
DOC.brief_title: A Multinomial Process Model Moral Judgment
DOC.detailed_description: - Medical Screening Interview : Participants ask answer several question identify potential medical non-medical condition would preclude self-administration testosterone . - First Saliva Sample : Participants ask provide saliva sample complete medical screening interview . - Testosterone Self-Administration : Immediately follow first saliva collection , participant self-administer spray puff either testosterone placebo . - Relaxation : Participants give opportunity relax 30 minute . - Second Saliva Sample : Participants ask provide saliva sample relaxation period . - Moral Dilemmas Judgments : Participants ask read set 28 moral dilemma describe situation actor make decision whether engage particular action ( e.g. , sacrifice well-being one person protect well-being several others ) . Participants ask indicate whether consider describe action acceptable unacceptable . - Demographics : Participants ask indicate gender , age , ethnicity . - Ear Temperature , heart rate , blood pressure measure drug administration , 20 minute drug administration . If temperature change 2 degree , heart rate change 20bmp , blood pressure change 20 % , experiment terminate subject escort across street University Emergency Room .
DOC.criteria: must currently enrol UTAustin comfortable selfadministration T purpose study le 18 year old BMI le 18 27 suffer physical health condition list prescreen questionnaire ( I ask mental health study mental health ) take medication list prescreen questionnaire currently pregnant ( female ) take chemical contraceptive ( female ) irregular cycle past 6 month ( female ) smoke 5 cigarettes/day use cocaine once/month ( **or I exclude use drug recreationally once/month ? ** ) drink 10 alcoholic beverages/week
